content.description: Fun, straightforward slab climbing leads up to a series of sidepulling flakes. Sustained, slightly overhung climbing on these positive incuts gets you to the anchors.
content.location: Two climbs left of Misty and Dale's Excellent Adventure (which climbs just right of the giant pigeon-nesting hole in the wall). Starts off on a long slab and leads up to bolts trending to the right up a system of flakes.

content.description: Voice of the Voiceless offers a satisfying capstone to Rage Against the Janine. After climbing Janine's pleasant slab, Voiceless launches up steep jugs to the top of the headwall. Powerful movement on great (though sharp holds) will earn you a nice view of McClinery Ridge.
content.protection: 5 (plus Janine's 6) bolts to cold shuts. Knot your 60m cord.
content.location: Voice of the Voiceless drives up the headwall directly above Rage Against the Janine. Climb Rage Against the Janice to its anchors the broad ledge midway up the wall. Clip the first bolt of Voiceless, immediately above Janine's anchor. Voiceless reaches the top of the steep headwall.

content.description: A tricky start off the ground leads into pleasant slab edging and big handholds.
content.location: The fifth route in the Funky Buddha Area pulls over a small slab onto ledge beneath the headwall. The route's extension onto the headwall is Voice of the Voiceless.

content.description: Climb through the first few easy bolts and crank through a short, steep section of climbing on positive edges. Pull onto the ledge above the crux section, shake out, and relax for the next couple bolts. On the headwall, the climbing thins out for a technical pump crux just below the anchor.
content.location: The last route in the Funky Buddha Area, climbing just right of a hole large enough to sit in.

content.description: The wall's titular route, Funky Buddha tackles the center of the vertical headwall past Buddha's bellybutton (the large, round hueco just above the slab). Smear your way up some waterpolished divots to a rest in the hueco. From there, edge, smear, and sidepull your way up some of Riggins' best limestone edges. Expect to feel a little air between your knees above the bolts. Thought-provoking and a bit pumpy.
content.protection: 9 bolts to chains, usually with fixed carabiners.
content.location: Funky Buddha climbs the plumb line up the center of its namesake wall. Begin by climbing the short, fixed rope up a mossy slab, about ten feet downhill from the large, needleless pine tree. Clip your first bolt about 10 feet right of the top of the fixed line, and trend slightly left into an almost body-size hueco ("Buddha's bellybutton"). From the hueco, the route fires up the headwall to its highest point. Note: Funky Buddha shares its third bolt with Big Stake, the route trending right up the same headwall.
